summary: This document is an internal FBI email chain from February 21, 2020, regarding a media inquiry from The Sun newspaper. The inquiry concerns a story about a former IT contractor on Jeffrey Epstein's island who claims to have witnessed Prince Andrew groping and kissing a young woman, believed to be Virginia Giuffre, between 2001 and 2004. The FBI agents coordinate on providing 'no comment' as their response.

persons.name: James Beal
persons.context: Journalist who sent the initial media inquiry to the FBI, asking for comment on a story about Prince Andrew and an alleged witness on Epstein's island.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Subject of the media inquiry; alleged to have been seen groping and kissing a young woman on Jeffrey Epstein's Little St. James island between 2001 and 2004.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referred to indirectly as the 'young-looking woman' or 'blonde girl' Prince Andrew was allegedly seen with; the witness was shown her picture in 2019 and now believes it was her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Owner of Little St. James island where the alleged incident involving Prince Andrew took place.

persons.name: Steve Scully
persons.context: Named in the email subject line alongside Prince Andrew; specific role or connection in the context is not detailed in the provided text.

connections.description: Based on the witness account in the media inquiry, Prince Andrew was allegedly seen groping and kissing Virginia Giuffre on Epstein's island.
The alleged incident took place on Epstein's private island, Little St. James, indicating a social connection.
Beal, as a journalist, is seeking comment or guidance from the FBI regarding a story about Prince Andrew and an Epstein witness.

events.title: Alleged incident on Little St. James
events.description: A former IT contractor alleges he saw Prince Andrew groping and kissing a young woman (believed to be Virginia Giuffre) by a swimming pool on Jeffrey Epstein's island.

events.title: Witness shown photo of Virginia Giuffre
events.description: The former IT contractor was shown a picture of Virginia Giuffre and subsequently believed she was the woman he saw with Prince Andrew.

events.title: FBI media inquiry coordination
events.description: FBI agents internally coordinate their response ('no comment') to a media inquiry from The Sun regarding the Prince Andrew allegations.

keyFacts: A former IT contractor on Epstein's Little St. James island claims to have witnessed Prince Andrew groping and kissing a young woman there between 2001 and 2004.
The witness estimates the incident lasted about 15 minutes while he fixed a phone line, and the woman did not appear to be resisting.
The witness was shown a picture of Virginia Giuffre in 2019 and now believes she was the woman with Prince Andrew.
The witness claims to have been questioned twice by the FBI about his links to Little St. James but was never specifically asked about Prince Andrew or Giuffre.
The FBI, upon receiving the media inquiry from The Sun, internally coordinated to provide 'no comment' as their official response.
